clinical_history: Routine screening chest X-ray with no specific complaints.
findings: Lung fields are clear bilaterally with no consolidation, infiltrates, or masses.
Bony thorax is intact with normal alignment, no fractures or lytic lesions.
Pulmonary vasculature appears normal with no evidence of congestion or edema.
Diaphragm and costophrenic angles are normal.
Cardiac silhouette is normal in size and contour.
No pleural effusion or pneumothorax is seen.
recommendations: Clinical correlation advised. Follow-up imaging may be recommended based on the clinical scenario.
